info.name: Stria terminalis
info.description: The stria terminalis is a small fiber bundle that originates in the amygdala and terminates in the septal area and hypothalamus. It is considered part of the limbic system. It follows a C-shaped course through the lateral ventricle where it is located in the groove between the thalamus and caudate nucleus and travels with the vena terminalis (aka terminal vein).
